raw.title: CVI.Finance - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Following the initial feedback of LTIPP Council, CVI would like to re-submit its LTIPP application.
The full proposal can be found here: 
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/cvi-ltipp-application-final/21947 

Request: 125,000 $ARB (Reduced from 250,000 $ARB)

### Summary:
CVI.Finance has revised their LTIPP grant proposal based on comprehensive feedback from the Arbitrum Council. In their commitment to align with Arbitrum's expectations and ecosystem, they significantly reduced their initial grant request by 50% and refined their strategic objectives to enhance trading excellence, market stability, and widespread engagement within the ecosystem.
### Key Adjustments:
Grant Size Reduction: From 250,000 $ARB to 125,000 $ARB to address council concerns about the original grant size and ensure responsible allocation of resources.

Focused Objectives:

* Trading Excellence and Activity: Allocating 40,000 $ARB to boost trading via competitions.
* Liquidity and Market Stability: Enhancing liquidity with a targeted 40,000 $ARB, focusing on a tiered incentive structure adjusted to the current $ARB price. This includes incentives for reaching up to $2M TVL.
* Trading Engagement: Increasing trading engagement through raffles and rebates totaling 45,000 $ARB.
### Council Feedback Response:
* Addressed Wintermute’s concerns on grant justification by halving the request and detailing fund distribution.
* Integrated GMX’s suggestions for clearer grant size justification and a phased funding approach.
* Responded to Karel’s feedback by ensuring milestones are based on tangible, proven results.

### Conclusion:
CVI’s revised proposal aligns closely with Arbitrum’s goals for growth and innovation. By scaling down the request and focusing on key performance metrics, CVI is committed to demonstrating the value and effectiveness of the project within the ecosystem.

raw.title: Deri Protocol - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Deri Protocol has updated the incentive mechanism and justification based on the council’s feedback, applying only 30% of the originally proposed grant.

Link to Application
https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/deri-protocol-ltipp-application-final/21566 

### Requested Grant Size:
USD equivalent: $230,769
ARB amount: 115,385 ARB at $2

### Justification
To determine the size of the grant we should request, we chose to benchmark against the current TVL increases that we’ve seen so far with our DERI incentives program. As detailed below, we expect to see at least a 250% increase in TVL heading to Arbitrum during the lifetime of this grant.
We target an average of 20% APR in ARB in our pool. To achieve this level of rewards for LPs on $5M TVL across 12 weeks, it would require the following:
USD equivalent = $5M * 20% *12/52 = $230,769
ARB amount = $$230,769/$2=115,385 ARB at $2


### Council Feedback: 
GFX Feedback)
We are supportive for 30% of the grant spend proposed. The remaining 70%, however, is to rebate users fees paid to the applicant. This is hard to support for several reasons. Firstly, the applicant hasn’t demonstrated that fee waivers worked to increase (and then retain) volume before asking for a large amount of funding. Secondly, rebating fees paid to the applicant, as opposed to gas or third party fees, is equivalent to governance directly giving the applicant funding. Thirdly, when fees are at or approach 100% and also are fees to the applicant, this creates a perverse incentive for the applicant to encourage wash trading, sybil farming, or steering the grant funds to rebate the highest margin trades. We recommend the applicant revise and resubmit in future grants cycles with either a different distribution mechanism or significant guard rails to address the concerns above.

Wintermute Feedback)
his application was decent and scored well across various criteria. Their execution strategy was clear however, it lacked any form of justification or calculations on how they intend to reach their milestones and KPIs. Incentives for LPs were not benchmarked against market rates and they just targeted arbitrary numbers for TVL and daily trading volume.
Their requested grant size is on the large end and is not sufficiently justified, this is further compounded by a lack of daily users.
Lastly, we are not sure if spending 70% of this grant on trading rebates are the best use of DAO funds.
We will not be supporting this application.

Karel Feedback)
    
Vote AGAINST Deri's proposal.

Decent proposal but unable to endorse for following reasons: (i) 70% of grant is set to go to the applicant as a fee rebate vs. end users is outside of LTIPP scope and may lead to misaligned incentives to encourage wash trading/sybiling/etc.; and (ii) insufficient justification on how they will achieve target milestones/KPIs.

Consider resubmitting with just the 30% grant size focused on LP rewards and greater justification on the above.

raw.title: Smilee Finance - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Following the feedback from the LTIPP Council, Smilee is submitting an amended proposal as per [Clarified Process for Non-Council Recommended Applications](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/clarified-process-for-non-council-recommended-applications-to-move-to-snapshot/23257).

Summary of Council feedback received (excluding who voted yes):

* GMX: Expresses reservations regarding the proposal due project maturity, performance metrics, and grant size relative to current status.
* KAREL: Suggests resubmitting the proposal in a later grants window with a reduced ask after demonstrating greater traction.
* GFX: Argues against financing fee subsidies to a grantee, citing the finite nature of grants funding.

Smilee Protocol launched shortly before the LTIPP application program deadline, but lacked proper tracking tools to demonstrate performance and traction.
Given that Smilee launched on March 15th, as of today, Smilee has been live for slightly more than 5 weeks, (with one week of trading paused for redeploying new smart contracts) and has achieved the following performances:

* Total Value Locked (TVL): $2M (increased cap from $2M to $3M on April 11, 2024)
* Trading Volumes: $13.7M
* Premium: ~$67K for Liquidity Providers (LPs)
* Unique Traders: 166

Even though Smilee has not disclosed any incentives, their TVL increased by more than 15% in a period of market downtrend.

Full details here:
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kcWjdr5TIO6WJceUE5eQJXcPtCUnHWgD/edit#gid=1980618672

Source: https://defillama.com/protocol/smilee-finance#tvl-charts

**Detailed performance metrics can be viewed at:**

* [https://dune.com/0xpibs/smilee-dashboard
](https://dune.com/0xpibs/smilee-dashboard)- [https://defillama.com/protocol/smilee-finance#options-volume ](https://defillama.com/protocol/smilee-finance#options-volume) (Please note that volume tracking commenced on April 4th, and thus does not include the initial $4.5M traded before redeployment.)

In response to feedback from the Council and recent performance trends, they propose resubmitting the application with a reduced grant amount by eliminating the fee rebate component.

**Setting the new grant request at 140K ARB, Smilee will implement the following incentive scheme:**

* Grow Smilee TVL from $2M to $5M.
  * Incentives APR = ~14%, less than 15% as suggested;
  * USD Equivalent of Earn Incentives = ~165K USD (Assuming ARB Price of 1.18$)
  * ARB Equivalent of Earn Incentives = 140K ARB

**Final LTIPP request: 140,000 ARB**

raw.title: Yearn Finance LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Yearn is submitting clarifications for our LTIPP proposal below. The amount 300k $ARB remains unchanged as that was not an issue based on feedback. 

The original post and updated comments can also be found here: https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/yearn-ltipp-application-final/21528/4

Summary of feedback from votes against:

* Incentive mechanism
  * Very little activity and TVL on Arbitrum today
* Execution plan
  * No milestones over the 12 weeks
* Grant Justification
  * Lack of net-new in-flows to Arbitrum

Responses:

* Very little activity and TVL on Arbitrum today
  * Back when the $ARB token went live, the pool of up-only Yearn strategy possibilities was very small on Arbitrum. We were only able to make strategies that had no exposure to IL, could take large deposits with little slippage, and were essentially lossless. DeFi activity on Arbitrum was booming, but did not align with these prerequisites.
  * Today we’re in a much better position. We’ve released Vaults V3 that allows us to open up Yearn strategies to a new spectrum of risk. In the past 30 days we’ve released 21 new vaults and strategies, with most of those coming out in the past 7 days.
  * We’ll ensure creative communications through Yearn twitter and other social channels.
* No milestones over the 12 weeks
  * We’ll divide incentives equally over 12 weeks and begin a push for both lending liquidity and yield boosts.
  * We propose the following milestones with the understanding that we will not receive the next stage of incentives if we do not cross the goal TVL:
    * Weeks 1-4
      * Goal: $10 million
    * Weeks 5-8
      * Goal: $20 million
    * Weeks 9-12
      * Goal: $30 million
* Lack of net-new in-flows to Arbitrum
  * We will prevent cannibalization between yield seekers by omitting Stargate, Curve, and Compound strategy boosting directly as these 3 farms exist on Arbitrum today.
  * We will enable net-new in-flows to Arbitrum through our Superform integration, a hub of L2 to L2 activity for Yearn: [Superform | Earn Yield & Distribute Vaults](https://app.superform.xyz/protocol/yearn/activity/)

We will focus on net-new strategies to Arbitrum that will grow:

* Pendle Penpie strategies
* Silo lending liquidity
  * Since the submission of this original proposal, we’ve engaged Silo to onboard to Juiced Vaults with the goal of net-new in flows to Arbitrum
* Llama lending liquidity
  * Since the submission of this original proposal, we’ve planned to onboard to Juiced Vaults for Llama Lend with the goal of net-new in flows to Arbitrum
* Ajna lending liquidity
* Gamma LP strategies

raw.title: Tradao - LTIPP [Post Council Feedback]
raw.author: 0xd333Bc5c9670C9cEb18f9A2CF02C6E86807a8227
raw.body:
Following the initial feedback of LTIPP Council, Tradao would like to re-submit its LTIPP application.

The full proposal can be found here:

[https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/tradao-ltipp-application-final/21884](https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/tradao-ltipp-application-final/21884)

## Request: 100,000 $ARB (Reduced from 190,000 $ARB)

### Feedback Summary:

The council feedback could be summarized as:

1. Wintermute: Criticized the large grant request, unverifiable metrics, and lack of anti-sybil measures

2. GMX: Lack of product-market fit and transaction numbers. Found the grant request to be inefficient and the incentive strategies unproven.

3. GFX: Highlighted concerns about the large grant size and the challenge in verifying Tradao's metrics. Recommended revising the application with enhanced sybil protection measures and to consider feedback from multiple reviewers for a future submission.

### Key Metric Update

As Tradao's permissionless copy trading function launched in early March before the LTIPP application program deadline, the metric of copy trading cannot fully reflect our product-market fit. Here is some update about our metric.

Previous

* Trading volume: 27,920,792
* Traded: 828
* Address: 66

New

* Trading volume: 70,540,917(Copy Trading) + 11,053,160(Direct Referral)
* Traded: 2,576
* Address: 153

Source:

1. https://dune.com/patrick_tradao/tradao-dashboard
2. https://www.gmxreferrals.com/arbitrum (Search Code: Tradaox)

### Key Adjustment

In response to feedback from the Council and recent dencun upgrade, we propose resubmitting the application with a reduced grant amount by removing the rebates of GMX's excution fee, eliminating trading competition and wallet generation incentive.

Setting the new grant request at 100K ARB, we will implement the following incentive scheme:

* Increase the total transacted volume via Tradao
  * Currently at $1.63M daily volume
  * Targeting ~$3M daily volume
* Incentivize fee rebate → less cost to trade → more trades → more volume and likely users
* As Tradao is totally free to every user, we don’t charge any cost from users. This means all the costs are the gas fee and the fee charged by GMX. We will rebate 80% of open fees back to users. To achieve this, at a target of $3M daily volume and 100 daily transactions, across 12 weeks, it would require:
  * USD equivalent = ($3M * 0.06% * 80%) * 365 * 12/52 = $121.29K
  * ARB amount = $121.29K / $1.2 = 100K ARB at $1.2

## Expected milestones

Initial unlock 33% of ARB

Milestone 1: 84m Trading Volume (66% of ARB unlocked & 33% of ARB distributed)

Milestone 2: 168m Trading Volume (100% of ARB unlocked & 66% of ARB Distributed)

Milestone 3: 252m Trading Volume (100% of ARB unlocked & 100% of ARB Distributed)

The Tradao team agrees to return to the Arbitrum DAO any unused ARB funds once the 12-week LTIPP program is concluded.

tvl_impact.error: Could not fetch TVL data: TVL cache not found for slug='arbitrum'

decision.summary: The proposal requests a 350k ARB grant to incentivize liquidity and trading volume growth on DODO's platform on Arbitrum, with a clear milestone plan and a focus on sustainable TVL growth. The timeline analysis and voting pattern strongly support 'For', and market impact shows positive price and TVL growth. Forum sentiment is mixed but slightly negative overall, with critiques mainly on grant size and milestone clarity; however, the team responded by halving the grant request and adding detailed milestones, gaining some support.
key_arguments_for: Strong timeline metrics show stable and early dominant support for 'For' option.
Adjacent similar proposals that recommended 'For' resulted in positive market price and stable or improved TVL.
The proposal includes detailed milestones, rational incentive design, and a plan for sustainable growth with dPoints system and new product launches.
DODO's unique PMM algorithm and existing integrations with major DEXs support composability and liquidity growth on Arbitrum.
key_arguments_against: Some forum comments raised concerns about the grant size being too large relative to current TVL and trading volume metrics.
Criticism on the use of fee rebates as part of the incentive distribution which has been consistently rejected by council previously.
Concerns on lack of historical data showing sustained volume and TVL post-incentives, questioning long-term retention.
Some delegations abstained or opposed due to insufficient detailed milestones initially and perceived overask.

evidence.reference: Forum posts on Arbitrum Foundation Discourse
evidence.quote: Three negative sentiment posts highlight concerns on grant size and milestone details; one positive post appreciates the detailed roadmap and reduced grant amount.
Lead ratio total for 'For' is 1.0 with perfect stability and early vote ratio, indicating strong early and consistent support.
Similar past proposals recommending 'For' showed positive token price impact and stable or growing TVL post vote.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'For' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Timeline metrics reveal strong, stable, and early dominant support for 'For', indicating clear voter intent.
• Market impacts from similar past proposals and current indicate positive price and TVL growth when 'For' was chosen.
• Forum sentiment is mixed but with majority neutral and some negative critiques centered on grant size and milestones; however, the team addressed these concerns by reducing the grant and clarifying milestones.
• The recommendation to 'For' aligns with maximizing long-term sustainable growth and liquidity on Arbitrum, even if some community sentiment is cautious, reflecting a reasoned balance between voter support and organizational benefit.
